docs.snippet: Woody Schneider owns tennis racket shops in Manhattan, but he also runs the National Tennis Center Pro Shop on a year-to-year contract, which stipulates that he has to empty out the shop during the United States Open....
docs.lead_paragraph: Woody Schneider owns tennis racket shops in Manhattan, but he also runs the National Tennis Center Pro Shop on a year-to-year contract, which stipulates that he has to empty out the shop during the United States Open.
docs.abstract: Woody Schneider, well-known tennis pro shop owner, makes his yearly exodus from his location at USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, Flushing, so venue can be repurposed for US Open activities.

headline.main: A Racket Maestro Makes His Yearly Migration

docs.snippet: Bolt and Gatlin, who have neither raced each other nor lost in their trademark sprints since 2013, both won their 100-meter heats Saturday at the world championships in Beijing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bolt and Gatlin, who have neither raced each other nor lost in their trademark sprints since 2013, both won their 100-meter heats Saturday at the world championships in Beijing.
docs.abstract: Usain Bolt and Justin Gatlin both win their 100-meter heats at world track and field championships in Beijing, bringing them closer to first-ever confrontation; possible showdown between celebrated Bolt and Gatlin, who has been sanctioned for doping offense, could be simplistically characterized by many as good versus evil.

headline.main: Looming Confrontation of Usain Bolt and Justin Gatlin Would Be a Morality Play
headline.print_headline: Looming Confrontation of Bolt and Gatlin Would Be a Morality Play

docs.snippet: In the digital economy, it was supposed to be impossible to make money by making art. Instead, creative careers are thriving — but in complicated and unexpected ways....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the digital economy, it was supposed to be impossible to make money by making art. Instead, creative careers are thriving — but in complicated and unexpected ways.
docs.abstract: Digital economy, which some predicted would destroy ability of artists to make a living, has instead allowed many to thrive; creatives have benefited from Internet era in new and unexpected ways.
